intro: Hieracium leiosoma subsp. melanocalyx, commonly known as the black-hued hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive dark green color, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. It is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
